intro: Tanacetum polycephalum subsp. heterophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flower heads that resemble those of tansy. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its aromatic, slightly bitter scent. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
